result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendell J. Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expunction hearing set for 11/25/15 @ 8:30 a.m - Restitution must be paid before expunction will be considered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: With Atty Edwards the expunction hearing set for 11/25/15 at 8:30am is removed from the calendar; Atty Edwards to notify deft to reschedule upon payment in full of outstanding costs.
Satisfaction of Commitment - Deft completed work crew in lieu of fine and costs (Restitution still due)
Restitution released to victim JY.  /  CK# 15CH073493
$1112.82 due in 30 days or civil judgment.  10% and 5% due to COC for restitutionn. (NO DOCUMENT AVAILABLE AT TIME OF SCANNING PER INTEGRITY CHECK OF FILE / PT)
For Ct 2 only - Dismissed and read in.
In the amount of: $4110.78
For restitution order - filed by ADA R Delgado.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed and read in.  State amends Ct 1 on the record to misdemeanor damage to property 943.01(1).  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  Restitution ordered in the amount of $4,110.78 (by stipulation of deft); civil judgment entered on restitution amount.  Court imposes sentence of 4 days jail w/credit for time served; costs ordered, 30 DTP or civil judgment.  Expunction hearing set for 11/25/15 at 8:30am; restitution must be paid before expunction will be considered.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards states there is an issue with value of property, whether or not this would be felony or misdemeanor.  FPT continued to 11/26/14 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 11/5/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
With Atty Edwards and Elizabeth/ADA Delgado the FPT of 9/24/14 at 8:45am is rescheduled to 9/22/14 at 8:45am, as Atty Edwards has a conflict.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Edwards.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DA PTC 9/12/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 9/24/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Atty Edwards acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft enters not guilty pleas.  DA PTC 8/15/14 at 1:30pm and FPT 9/2/14 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Bond previously posted ordered forfeited, but that is also stayed until 7-18-14 @ 1:00pm.
